trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Replicon | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Replicon | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Replicon with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Replicon with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Replicon.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Replicon.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Replicon tenant
trans-unit.target: A Replicon tenant

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Replicon will be able to single sign into the application at your Replicon company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Replicon will be able to single sign into the application at your Replicon company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Replicon
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Replicon

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Replicon.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Replicon.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Replicon.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Replicon.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Replicon, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Replicon, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Replicon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Replicon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Replicon with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Replicon with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Replicon application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Replicon application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Replicon page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Replicon page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure app URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Replicon Sign On URL textbox, type your Replicon tenant URL (e.g.: https://na2.replicon.com/company/saml2/sp-sso/post).
trans-unit.target: In the Replicon Sign On URL textbox, type your Replicon tenant URL (e.g.: https://na2.replicon.com/company/saml2/sp-sso/post).

trans-unit.source: In the Replicon Reply URL textbox, type your Replicon AssertionConsumerService URL(e.g.: https://global.replicon.com/!/saml2/company/sso/post).
trans-unit.target: In the Replicon Reply URL textbox, type your Replicon AssertionConsumerService URL(e.g.: https://global.replicon.com/!/saml2/company/sso/post).

trans-unit.source: You can get the URL from the Replicon metadata at: https://global.replicon.com/!/saml2/\.
trans-unit.target: You can get the URL from the Replicon metadata at: https://global.replicon.com/!/saml2/\.

trans-unit.source: Click Next
trans-unit.target: Click Next

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Replicon page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Replicon page, to download your metadata, click Download metadata, and then save the metadata on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Replicon company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Replicon company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: To configure SAML 2.0, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: To configure SAML 2.0, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable SAML authentication</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable SAML authentication</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To display the EnableSAML Authentication2 dialog, append the following to your URL, after your company key: /services/SecurityService1.svc/help/test/EnableSAMLAuthentication2 The following shows the schema of the complete URL: https://na2.replicon.com/\/services/SecurityService1.svc/help/test/EnableSAMLAuthentication2
trans-unit.target: To display the EnableSAML Authentication2 dialog, append the following to your URL, after your company key: /services/SecurityService1.svc/help/test/EnableSAMLAuthentication2 The following shows the schema of the complete URL: https://na2.replicon.com/\/services/SecurityService1.svc/help/test/EnableSAMLAuthentication2

trans-unit.source: Click the + to expand the v20Configuration section.
trans-unit.target: Click the + to expand the v20Configuration section.

trans-unit.source: Click the + to expand the metaDataConfiguration section.
trans-unit.target: Click the + to expand the metaDataConfiguration section.

trans-unit.source: Click Choose File, to select your identity provider metadata XML file, and click Submit.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose File, to select your identity provider metadata XML file, and click Submit.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure single sign-on</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Replicon, they must be provisioned into Replicon.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Replicon, they must be provisioned into Replicon.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Replicon, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Replicon, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: In a web browser window, log into your Replicon company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a web browser window, log into your Replicon company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to Administration \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to Administration \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click +Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click +Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the User Profile section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the User Profile section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>User profile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>User profile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Login Name textbox, type the Azure AD email address of the Azure AD user you want to provision.
trans-unit.target: In the Login Name textbox, type the Azure AD email address of the Azure AD user you want to provision.

trans-unit.source: As Authentication Type, select SSO.
trans-unit.target: As Authentication Type, select SSO.

trans-unit.source: In the Department textbox, type the user’s department.
trans-unit.target: In the Department textbox, type the user’s department.

trans-unit.source: As Employee Type, select Administrator.
trans-unit.target: As Employee Type, select Administrator.

trans-unit.source: Click Save User Profile.
trans-unit.target: Click Save User Profile.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Replicon user account creation tools or APIs provided by Replicon to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Replicon user account creation tools or APIs provided by Replicon to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Replicon **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Replicon **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
